results.title: At Least 8 Killed After Driver Plows Car Into Group of Migrants in Texas
results.abstract: The driver of a Range Rover barreled into a crowd in Brownsville, Texas, on Sunday, officials said. It was unclear if the crash had been accidental or deliberate.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Refugees and Displaced Persons;Ukraine;Pokrovsk (Ukraine);Russia
results.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman and Finbarr O’Reilly
results.title: Ukrainians Return Home, Renewed and Resigned
results.abstract: More than 5.5 million people who left after the war began in February 2022 have gone back home — and not just to large cities like Kyiv or Dnipro, but to small places near the front line, as well.

media.caption: Passengers on a train from Lviv and Kyiv arrive in town of Pokrovsk in the eastern Donetsk region, last week.
media.copyright: Finbarr O'Reilly for The New York Times

results.title: In Trump Case, Bragg Pursues a Common Charge With a Rarely Used Strategy
results.abstract: A review of more than two dozen cases shows that in at least one sense, the indictment of the former president stands apart.

media.caption: Alvin L. Bragg, the Manhattan district attorney, has argued that the charges against former President Donald J. Trump fit the facts of the case.

results.title: Submerged Island Off Florida Reveals Secret: Civil War-Era Cemetery
results.abstract: The site, discovered by marine archaeologists about 70 miles from Key West, Fla., once held a quarantine hospital and cemetery for those stationed at Fort Jefferson in the Dry Tortugas National Park.

media.caption: Devon Fogarty, a University of Miami graduate student, examining the headstone of John Greer, which was found underwater during a survey at Dry Tortugas National Park in Florida in August 2022.
media.copyright: C. Sproul/National Park Service, via Associated Press

results.title: Before Dylan, There Was Connie Converse. Then She Vanished.
results.abstract: There’s a resurgence of interest in the pioneering singer-songwriter who disappeared when she was 50.

results.abstract: Wharton’s Ben Keys on how climate change is already reshaping the insurance and housing markets — and how our denial is only making the problem worse.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Classical Music;Pressler, Menahem;Beaux Arts Trio
results.title: Menahem Pressler, Pianist Who Co-Founded Beaux Arts Trio, Dies at 99
results.abstract: Mr. Pressler, who fled Nazi Germany as a youth, was the anchor of a group that, with various lineups, performed all over the world for 53 years.

media.caption: The pianist Menahem Pressler in concert at the Museum of Modern Art in New York in 2011. When the Beaux Arts Trio disbanded in 2008, he was the last original member still in the trio.
media.copyright: Matthew Dine for The New York Times

results.title: Why Americans Feel More Pain
results.abstract: Chronic pain is not just a result of car accidents and workplace injuries but is also linked to troubled childhoods, loneliness, job insecurity and a hundred other pressures on working families.

media.caption: When Bobbie Wert feels pain coming on, she repeats to herself, “It’s not so bad.”

results.title: Vida Blue, Pitching Sensation for Champion A’s Teams, Dies at 73
results.abstract: In his rookie season in 1971, he was an unstoppable fastball pitcher. Then he had a fight with the owner of the Athletics that left him embittered.

media.caption: Vida Blue in 1976. In his early years in baseball as a pitching sensation, it seemed as though he couldn’t lose. He appeared on the covers of Time magazine and Sports Illustrated.

results.byline: By Michael Wilson and Andy Newman
results.title: How Two Men’s Disparate Paths Crossed in a Killing on the F Train
results.abstract: Jordan Neely’s mental health decline played out in public after his mother was strangled. Daniel Penny said he was protecting himself and others when he choked Mr. Neely.

media.caption: Jordan Neely found a calling performing as a young Michael Jackson and entertaining subway riders. But he became more desperate, and sometimes violent, as his mental health declined.
media.copyright: Andrew Savulich/New York Daily News/Tribune News Service, via Getty Images
